chapter.title: Installation
chapter.para: The Seam Exception Handling API is the only compile time dependency a project needs, and an implementation must also be included, either explicitly or via some other module depending on it (and exposing their own specialized extension) is all that is needed during runtime. If you are using Maven as your build tool, you can add the following dependency to your pom.xml file:

note.para: The runtime dependency is only needed if another Seam 3 module being used doesn't already use it. Typically this will only be for Java SE development.

tip.para: Replace ${seam-catch-version} with the most recent or appropriate version of Seam Exception Handling.
